Description: Painted and gilded cartonnage mummy-mask with a striped lappet-wig; representation of Khepri on top of the head; Hieroglyphic text around the fillet; on the back are three painted panels, the uppermost depicting Sekhmet, Isis, Horus and Osiris, the lower two depicting winged deities.
Curator's comments: Found with 1897,0511.191 Bibliographical reference: L. Miatello, 'Ptolemaic mummy masks with spells from the Book of the Dead concerning the head', JSSEA 39 (2012-13).
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2015 – 2016 4 Dec – 29 May, National Museum of Singapore, ‘Treasures of the World’s Cultures’ 2012 Mar-Jul, Abu Dhabi, Manarat Al Saadiyat, Treasures of the World’s Cultures 2012-2013 Nov-Mar, Bonn, Kunst- und Ausstellungshalle, Treasures of the World's Cultures
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
